intro: Stenostephanus cuscoensis, commonly known as the Cusco stephanus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in the cool, dry climates of its native habitat. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Due to its limited distribution and specific environmental requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
